question.text: Substrate level phosphorylation occurs during which step of Krebs' cycle?

options.text: Succinyl-<math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> →</mi></math> Succinic acid
Malic acid →<math><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

solution.text: Succinyl co-A (4C) undergoes hydration (addition of water) to form Succinic acid (4C) in the presence of enzyme Succinyl thiokinase. The energy liberated in this reaction is used to combine GDP & iP to form GTP (Guanosine triphosphate). GTP is relatively unstable and is soon transformed to ATP using ADP. Thus ATP is generated by substrate level phosphorylation (without ETS)
